attachment.name: Photos from The Straits Times's post

media.alt: Pearls Centre has to make way for underground tunnelling works for the $18 billion Thomson Line, Singapore’s sixth MRT line, spanning 30km and 22 stations. By the end of Tuesday (March 1), the Singapore Land Authority had taken over and hoarding was put up around the building in Chinatown. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

Lorry driver Liu Hai Jun (in black shirt), 36, helping to move a resident's furniture at Pearls Centre on Monday. Residents had to hand their apartments over to the centre’s management that day. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI
Meanwhile, shops on the fourth floor of the centre were all shut. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

Mobile phone ads are seen on the building’s lift doors. There were a total of 199 commercial units in the centre’s four-storey mall and shops included travel agencies, beauty parlours, traditional Chinese medicine shops and eateries. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

Posters pinned on notice boards show images of KTV hostesses and movie timings for Yangtze Cinema. The cinema began to screen R21 movies in 1995 due to the slowdown in the local movie industry and the rise of modern cineplexes. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

The escalator leading to Yangtze Cinema’s two halls. The cinema used to have four halls. In 2011, when its popularity dipped, two halls were converted into a nightclub with a bar, a stage and 24 private KTV rooms.ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

One of the halls of Yangtze Cinema, which opened in 1977 and started business showing mainly Hong Kong martial arts films. The cinema later became known for screening R21 movies from Europe, Japan and South Korea. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

Film reels stored inside the projector room of Yangtze Cinema. The two halls at the cinema in Pearls Centre screened their last R21 movies at 5pm on Monday. The acquisition of the centre was announced by the Government in 2012. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

A fireproof sliding door at the carpark of Pearls Centre. The 23-storey strata-titled building began its 99-year lease in 1969. Besides the 199 commercial units in the mall, it has 44 one-, two- and three-room residential units on 11 floors. ST PHOTO: LIM YAOHUI

message: Pearls Centre in Chinatown has to go due to underground tunnelling works for the $18 billion Thomson Line. ST photojournalist Lim Yaohui chronicles the building's last days. http://str.sg/ZyaR

attachment.description: The Laguna Park condo, which made headlines in the past year for its spate of vandalism cases due to disputes in its en bloc sale process, reached the 80 per cent consent level last December. --ST PHOTO: ADELINE ONG

attachment.description: TOKYO - MICROSOFT Corp says it is cutting the price in Japan of its high-end Xbox 360 game console by 25 per cent to 29,800 yen (S$463).

message: Microsoft to cut price in Japan of Xbox 360 game console by 25% to 29,800 yen (S$463), effective Sept 10. http://bit.ly/2kdba
